question: When advertising is scheduled to run constantly without variation, this is referred to as ________.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. A pulsing schedule has the advertisement being shown continuously, with periods where the ad is shown at a higher rate as well as periods where it is shown at a lower rate.
That’s not correct. Reach refers to the number of consumers that see the advertisement.
That’s not correct. A flighting schedule has periods of advertising followed by periods of time without the ad being shown.
With continuity scheduling, an advertiser is showing its advertisement on a continuous schedule without variation.

detailedSolution: With continuity scheduling, an advertiser is showing its advertisement on a continuous schedule without variation.
